title: Micheál Martin - Wikipedia
snippet: Micheál Martin (Irish: [ˈmʲiːçaːl̪ˠ]; born 16 August 1960) is an Irish Fianna Fáil politician serving as Taoiseach since January 2025, having previously held the position from 2020 to 2022. Martin served as Tánaiste, Minister for Foreign Affairs and Minister for Defence from December ...

title: Micheál Martin returns as Ireland's prime minister after securing backing of the parliament | AP News
snippet: DUBLIN (AP) — Irish lawmakers ... a coalition government. Members of the lower house of parliament, the Dáil, voted by 95 to 76 to confirm Martin as taoiseach, the Irish title for prime minister....

title: Leo Varadkar becomes taoiseach as Micheál Martin steps down
snippet: Now, the Fianna Fáil leader Micheál Martin has handed over the most important job in Ireland to his Fine Gael counterpart, Leo Varadkar. The parties agreed the deal after a general election in 2020, when Sinn Féin surged to win the most ...

title: Micheal Martin | Taoiseach, Previous Offices, & Family Tragedy | Britannica
snippet: As leader of Fianna Fáil, Martin assumed the role of taoiseach on June 27, 2020. At University College Cork, Micheál Martin studied history and Irish, earning a bachelor’s degree.
